go online on your search engine, and type in online college, and you should see what I saw. Thanks Mary
Leslie Avery wrote:I have two sons who are college age and don't want the
trappings of college but would like to homeschool
college. I would also like more info.

Leslie

Masters DegreesOn-Line
MBA ProgramsOther Educational Resources On-Line Colleges Degrees CoursesThe Path to Career Success Begins Here.
The decision to pursue higher education could not be made at a better time.
Employers today are demanding more education from their employees than ever before. A degree will carry significant value in any organization's hiring and career advancement decisions.
Plus, there is a direct correlation between higher salaries and furthering your education.
The U.S. Department of Commerce reports that:Bachelor degree holders make 96% more than those with only a high school educationMBA degree holders make 145% more than those with only a high school education

Myranda wrote:I didn't realize this was possible! I'd love more information on it, neither DH or I have a college degree and would be interested for us as well as for the kids!!
Myranda

Hi Everyone,

I recently met a gal online who told me she was currently
homeschooling her kids, and would homeschool them through college
also. I asked her how she planned on homeschooling college, but
haven't heard back from her.

I was wondering what everyone here thought of homeschooling college.
Personally, I would love to homeschool myself, as I haven't been back
to college since I had my kids, and I don't see myself getting back
there in the near future. Yet I would LOVE a degree in
psychology :::grin:::

Any thoughts anyone???

Twinkles,
Deanna

magical moms in the Inland Empire.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Homeschooling College
messages.msgSnippet: There are several colleges where you can get an online degree or just take whatever classes interest you.  I am also looking into psychology degrees, so let me
messages.messageBody:
There are several colleges where you can get an online degree or just take whatever classes interest you. I am also looking into psychology degrees, so let me know if you would like specific info on what I have found so far. Email me at jgreen@....

Jen


----- Original Message -----
From: singingmoonmama
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, September 16, 2002 2:53 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Homeschooling College


Hi Everyone,

I recently met a gal online who told me she was currently
homeschooling her kids, and would homeschool them through college
also. I asked her how she planned on homeschooling college, but
haven't heard back from her.

I was wondering what everyone here thought of homeschooling college.
Personally, I would love to homeschool myself, as I haven't been back
to college since I had my kids, and I don't see myself getting back
there in the near future. Yet I would LOVE a degree in
psychology :::grin:::

Any thoughts anyone???

Twinkles,
Deanna

http://groups.yahoo.com/group/InlandEmpireMageMamas/ - A place for
magical moms in the Inland Empire.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Homeschooling College
messages.msgSnippet: ... I imagine she meant doing a distance learning degree ... The Open University - now available in the US offers degrees you can study from home, as well as
messages.messageBody:
On 16 Sep 02, at 19:53, singingmoonmama wrote:

> Hi Everyone,
>
> I recently met a gal online who told me she was currently
> homeschooling her kids, and would homeschool them through college
> also. I asked her how she planned on homeschooling college, but
> haven't heard back from her.

I imagine she meant doing a distance learning degree
>
> I was wondering what everyone here thought of homeschooling college.
> Personally, I would love to homeschool myself, as I haven't been back
> to college since I had my kids, and I don't see myself getting back
> there in the near future. Yet I would LOVE a degree in psychology
> :::grin:::

The Open University - now available in the US offers degrees you
can study from home, as well as Masters degrees. I started doing
a Masters but ran out of cash.
Doing an OU degree (they are very popular in the UK) means you
can take it as fast or as slowly as you want. Plus you have time to
be with your kids or work if you need. The OU also accept students
without formal qualifications like A level and whatever it is
Americans get at 18.

Shyrley


"You laugh at me because I'm different. I laugh at you because you are all the same."

messages.subject: Homeschooling College
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Everyone, I recently met a gal online who told me she was currently homeschooling her kids, and would homeschool them through college also. I asked her how
messages.messageBody:
Hi Everyone,

I recently met a gal online who told me she was currently
homeschooling her kids, and would homeschool them through college
also. I asked her how she planned on homeschooling college, but
haven't heard back from her.

I was wondering what everyone here thought of homeschooling college.
Personally, I would love to homeschool myself, as I haven't been back
to college since I had my kids, and I don't see myself getting back
there in the near future. Yet I would LOVE a degree in
psychology :::grin:::

Any thoughts anyone???

Twinkles,
Deanna
